titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Orange County, Queens County, and New York City legal documents 1977.061
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.unittitle: Orange County, Queens County, and New York City legal documents
did.abstract: This collection contains a small assortment of legal documents relating to residents of Orange County, Queens County, and New York, N.Y.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Orange County, Queens County, and New York City legal documents, 1977.061, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a small assortment of legal documents relating to residents of Orange County, Queens County, and New York, N.Y. Orange County documents include a 1769 release from Harmanus Hoffman to William Dobbs, and two deeds involving Abraham, Hendrick, and Jacobus Wannamaker, dated 1794. Queens County documents include two deeds from 1688 and 1698 involving Thomas Wigons (also spelled Wigings) of the town of Jamaica. The one New York City document included in the collection is a deed from 1807 involving Andrew Suffren and merchants William Bayard (1761-1826) and James McEvers. Also included are two military certificates from 1866 issued to Edward C. Phillips (b. 1854 or 5) of the First Regiment of the California Volunteer Infantry.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain.

While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
